alert.note: Alert for Callaway; Osage (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 1:53PM CDT until July 29 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN RALLS COUNTY IN NORTHEASTERN MISSOURI...AUDRAIN COUNTY IN CENTRAL MISSOURI...MONTGOMERY COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI...EASTERN CALLAWAY COUNTY IN CENTRAL MISSOURI...SOUTHEASTERN MONROE COUNTY IN NORTHEASTERN MISSOURI...NORTHWESTERN FRANKLIN COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI...NORTHEASTERN OSAGE COUNTY IN CENTRAL MISSOURI...NORTHWESTERN WARREN COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI... SOUTHWESTERN PIKE COUNTY IN NORTHEASTERN MISSOURI AND NORTHERN GASCONADE COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI... At 152 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Martinsburg to 8 miles northwest of Linn, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 150 PM estimated wind gusts of 60 mph were reported in Mexico. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Montgomery City, Wellsville, Chamois, Mineola, New Florence, Buell, Bellflower, Big Spring, Hermann, Jonesburg and Swiss. This also includes Deutschheim Historic Site and Graham Cave State Park. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 148 and 183. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
